title: Paris Shopping
name: Paris Shopping
description:
A Map by Silviatc

Shops I want to hit up in Paris

properties.name: Alternatives
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc18 rue du Roi de Sicile, paris, france"Located near the Place des Vosges in the bohemian-chic Marais, Alternatives offers a tempting mix of well-priced designer ready-to-wear and lesser-known labels. In the designer category was an olive-green silk, knee-length Yohji Yamamoto skirt for £259, while a peach-coloured Martine Sitbon cotton blouse was £30. A sparkly but sporty Marc Jacobs blazer was £84; Louis Vuitton, Hermès, and Prada trousers cost from £54 and a staggeringly chic, knee-length black skirt with a four-inch flared panel around the hemline turned out to be Balenciaga - at £84. Dresses, coats, bags, shoes and men\'s clothing are also on offer."

properties.name: Boucherie
properties.description: Posted by SilviatcRue Lucien Sampaix. 10.arr., Paris, France"I discovered this amazing vintage store on my way to the Canal St. Martin, with no shopping in mind and little cash in my wallet. Still, I dragged my boyfriend inside the treasure house and found this lovely white dress at just 15 euros."

properties.name: Casablanca
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc17 rue Moret, paris, france"This big shop is filled with anything from Roaming Twenties gowns to Sixties iconic dresses and also includes a large selection of men clothes... Very good for a nice retro look at a good price."

properties.name: Depot Vente Du 17ème
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc109 rue de Courcelles, paris, france"The men\'s section is even more affordable than the women\'s, with Burberry coats at under 50."

properties.name: Falbalas
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc140 rue des Rosiers, St Ouen, France"The place is especially good for turn-of-the-century skirts, or New Look dresses. The owners are very knowledgeable and friendly. They also sell a nice selection of retro shoes of their own design. No credit cards"

properties.name: Free ‘P’ Star
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc8 Ste-Croix-de-la-Bretonnerie, paris, france"This is the ultimate shop for a girl or boy with a love for vintage shopping. Free ‘P’ Star has tonns of glitering and glammy clothes from the 60, 70 and 80ies. You can find amazing dresses, ex-army jackets for 50NOK and last but not least fur jackets for 400-700NOK."

properties.name: Fuschia Dentelles
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc2 rue de l\'Avé-Maria, paris, france"his serious outsider of Francine Dentelles in the nice area of Village Saint-Paul sells valuables like a 1925 cloche hat (150 euros), old cottons and a short selection of retro dresses."

properties.name: Guerrisol
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc 19-33 ave. de Clichy, paris, france"It isn’t glamorous; it doesn’t sell designer cloths; it’s in a poor work-a-day neighborhood, and it’s one of the best known stores in Paris for used clothes (used with a capital U). There are piles upon piles and racks upon racks of used clothes spread out over several stores. You simply can’t beat the price."

properties.name: Ken Claude
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc55 rue de Turenne, paris, france"It look small from outside but the shop is Huge, plenty of amazing vintage things."

properties.name: Kennedy Noir
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc22 Rue du Roi de Sicile, Paris, France"In this dark shop selling vintage clothing and shoes and jeans from April 77 and Cheap Monday, it\'s easy to find something worth buying."

properties.name: Kiliwatch
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc84 rue Tiquetonne, paris, france"More pricey.. but a great place for vintage and new merchandise (located in the back of the store). More individualized items can be found such as jewelry, band t-shirts, and leather pumps."

properties.name: Le Jupon rouge
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc19 rue de Rochechouart, paris, france"The selection varies, but I’ve also found a MARNI 70ies inspired dress for 150 euroes."

properties.name: Le Misentroc
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc63 rue Notre-Dame des Champs, paris, france"Offers a good mixture of classically elegant fashions and trendier pieces. Black leather skirts were £45-£64; a romantic, whimsical white Lacroix dress was £118; a chocolate brown cotton eyelet blouse with a matching skirt, £78; a sleek Vivienne Westwood dress, £84; and Versace jeans, £30. While I tried on clothes, long-haired students and willowy actresses wandered in - regulars who love Misentroc for its eclectic shopping, hip location, and friendly atmosphere."

properties.name: Maison de FanFan
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc4, Rue Mayet, paris, france"FanFan is a small secondhand shop across the street from Tea and Tattered Pages, the English-language bookstore. Here they sell Hermes, Chanel, Vuitton, Dior, and used items from other designers. The shop is homey, and the folks here are friendlier than most."

properties.name: Mam'zelle Swing
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc35Bis, rue du Roi de Sicile, paris, france"The stock is well selected and can include anything from a 1900\'s shirt to a Courrèges suit. The clothes are reasonably priced with many items below 100 euros."

properties.name: Mamie
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc73 rue de Rochechouart, Paris, France"a three-storeyed vintage store crammed with everything you can imagine of 50\'s, 60\'s and 70\'s stuff"

properties.name: Puces de Vanves
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc"the last true flea market of Paris offers some very good bargains on Vintage clothes... The search can be quite a hit-and-miss, but on a sunny day it can make a nice adventure."

properties.name: Rag
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc85 rue St. Martin, Paris, France"a good selection of vintage boots and shoes" "They have the best selection of vintage boots and sell vintage Burberry coats for 80 euros." (http://ellenscloset.blogspot.com/2007/02/fight-booring-winter-add-belt-to-your.html)

properties.name: Rag Time
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc23 rue de l\'Echaude, Paris, France"Ragtime is a great source for inspiration to designers both in Paris and abroad."

properties.name: Reciproque
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc123 Rue de la Pompe, paris, france"Hands down the coolest secondhand store in Paris, Reciproque has everything from designer clothes and accessories to tableware, jewelry, paintings, and furniture. It\'s the largest luxury consignment shop in the city, with seven different boutique-sized sections, and the selection is well chosen. You will not find the clutter typical of many the depot ventes, as every shop is organized by designer, clothing type, and color. Every well-known designer from around the world is represented in their collection."

properties.name: Stock shops
properties.description: Posted by Silviatcrue d\'Alésia, Paris, France"You\'ll find zillions of "stock" shops roughly between the Alésia and Plaisance métro stops. Stock shops are France\'s answer to outlet stores: with a good eye, you can find last year\'s designer styles at greatly reduced prices."

properties.name: Sunday Market @ Les Marchés Saint-Ouen
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc136 avenue Michelet, st ouen, france"For clothing: le marché Malik. For miscellany: le marché Vernaison." Also mentioned in: http://ellenscloset.blogspot.com/2007/03/me-wants-blue-pumps.html "Irma- On a rack outside the shop you may find the occasional Sixties dress for a bargain. Marché Vernaison, Stand 200, allée n°9" (http://paris-vintage.blogspot.com/)

properties.name: Tempolini
properties.description: Posted by Silviatc5 Rue Gérando, Paris, France"The cute lady who owns the store offers shirts, dresses, boots, pumps, vintage Nike and PanAm bags and vintage accessories such as earrings and necklaces. I found a short tweed vintage LaFayette jacket for 30 euroes, and a kitsch vintage Burberry shirt for 20 euros."
